reviewText: It makes no matter which side you are on (about the subject of juveniles being tried as adults or children or about our judicial system--should it scrapped for letting a computer determine if someone is guilty or not and the sentence or should we keep our current method of deciding guilt or innocence and if guilty what should the judge use to decide the sentence) you will see new ways that scientists can add information to a trial and to our knowledge about the most unknown part of the human body--the brain. Alan Alda not only acts as host, but also becomes a guinea pig himself in some of the ways scientists are exploring the brain.
